p: In Table 5, the mean comparison of different concentrations of extract within a group and with the standard antibacterial disc was presented. As shown in the table, all concentrations of plant extract showed a statistically significant difference ( p < 0.001) as compared with the positive control in all standard bacteria. In addition, the 200 mg/mL concentration of extract had significant difference ( p < 0.01) for S. typhi and E. coli and p < 0.001 for P. aeruginosa as compared with 400 mg/mL of crude extract. It had also a p-value < 0.001 as compared with 800 mg/mL concentration for S. typhi, E. coli and P. aeruginosa while, the p-value is less than 0.01 for S. flexneri. In addition, the 400 mg/kg concentration of test extract showed a significant difference ( p < 0.01) as compared with 800 mg/mL for E. coli and P. aeruginosa, while p < 0.05 for S. flexneri.
